message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
public void paintComponent(Graphics g){
    super.paintComponent(g);
    if(buttonsSelected>1)
    {
        g.setColor(new Color(0xE3, 0xC9, 0x39));
        for(Iterator<JRadioButton> it = Arrays.asList(buttonTest).iterator(); it.hasNext();)
        {
            JRadioButton currentButton = it.next();
            if(it.hasNext()){
                JRadioButton nextButton = it.next();
                g.drawLine(currentButton.getX(), currentButton.getY(), nextButton.getX(), nextButton.getY());
            }
            System.out.println("Ole!");
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the Iterator.next() method to iterate over your array of JRadioButtons. In each iteration, you get the current button and the next button, and draw a line between them. This way, you draw a line between each pair of consecutive buttons. Note that you need to check if there is a next button before trying to get it, to avoid a NoSuchElementException.
